tournament.name: South American Magic Series - Regional Championship - Magicsur Chile

decks.notes: The main concept of this deck is to efficiently utilize the Omniscience combo to overwhelm the opponent with powerful creatures and spells. The deck includes cards to ramp up mana quickly, draw cards, counter opponent's spells, and manipulate the board state. By setting up Omniscience, the player can cast spells for free and take advantage of powerful effects like Roiling Dragonstorm to deal massive damage or Floodfarm Verge to control the opponent's options. The deck aims to create a lockout situation where the opponent is unable to effectively respond to the player's threats.

The key strategy of this deck revolves around disrupting the opponent's plays with counterspells and hand disruption while quickly building a board presence with efficient and aggressive creatures. By applying pressure early on and controlling the game through disruption spells, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent before they have a chance to stabilize. The inclusion of powerful finishers like Sheoldred, the Apocalypse and Kaito, Bane of Nightmares ensures that the deck can close out games quickly once it gains momentum. Overall, the deck aims to be proactive and disruptive, maintaining control of the game while applying pressure to secure victories.

This Dimir Aggro deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with low-cost aggressive creatures like Deep-Cavern Bat and Preacher of the Schism. The deck also includes disruptive spells like Duress and Spell Pierce to control the board and protect your creatures. Enduring Curiosity helps draw cards to maintain momentum, while Sheoldred, the Apocalypse and other powerful creatures provide late-game threats. The deck's mana base and removal spells like Go for the Throat ensure a consistent and aggressive game plan from start to finish.

The deck focuses on dealing damage quickly and efficiently through aggressive plays and spell-based removal. It combines a mix of burn spells, creatures with evasion abilities, and card draw to maintain tempo and pressure the opponent. The key strategy is to control the board early with removal spells and then use aggressive creatures to finish off the opponent quickly. With a good balance of spells and creatures, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent before they can stabilize.

The main concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast-paced aggressive strategy using various creatures, spells, and control elements. By combining the powerful abilities of cards like Preacher of the Schism, Spyglass Siren, and Floodpits Drowner with removal spells like Go for the Throat and Cut Down, the deck aims to pressure the opponent early and maintain tempo throughout the game. The inclusion of cards like Sheoldred, the Apocalypse and Tishana's Tidebinder provide additional strength and versatility to the deck's game plan.

This deck focuses on quickly and efficiently dealing damage to the opponent's life total using aggressive creatures and burn spells. It also utilizes card draw and filtering to maintain its speed and consistency. The key strategy is to control the board early with efficient creatures and disrupt the opponent's game plan while applying pressure with direct damage spells. The mana base is carefully constructed to ensure that the deck can consistently cast its spells on curve.

This deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with aggressive creatures and burn spells. Drake Hatcher and Cori-Steel Cutter provide early threats, while Slickshot Show-Off and Monastery Swiftspear deliver additional damage. Into the Flood Maw and Monstrous Rage boost the power of creatures, while Torch the Tower and Burst Lightning provide direct damage to clear the way for attacks. The deck is designed to maintain a fast pace with card draw from Opt, Sleight of Hand, and Stock Up, ensuring a constant stream of threats and burn spells.

The main concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of aggressive creatures and disruptive spells. By utilizing efficient creatures like Floodpits Drowner and Spyglass Siren, along with removal options like Raise the Past and Sheltered by Ghosts, the deck aims to quickly build a board presence while disrupting the opponent's game plan. Additionally, the inclusion of cards like Enduring Curiosity and Warden of the Inner Sky provide card advantage and resilience to help maintain pressure on the opponent. Overall, the deck focuses on fast-paced aggression and disruption to secure victory.

This deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with evasive creatures and disruptive spells. The key strategy is to constantly pressure the opponent's life total while controlling the board with removal spells and counterspells. Faeries are the primary creature type in this deck, utilizing synergy and tribal bonuses to maximize their effectiveness. Tishana's Tidebinder and Preacher of the Schism provide additional support for the aggro plan, while cards like Spell Stutter and Spell Pierce help to maintain tempo and disrupt the opponent's game plan. Overall, the deck aims to win the game by staying one step ahead of the opponent and closing out the game quickly.

This deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with aggressive creature threats while disrupting their game plan with targeted removal and hand disruption spells. The key strategy is to maintain a strong board presence with powerful creatures like Sheoldred, the Apocalypse and Preacher of the Schism, while using cards like Duress and Spell Pierce to disrupt the opponent's plans. The deck also includes card draw and protection to ensure that it can maintain pressure on the opponent and close out the game efficiently.

The deck focuses on utilizing combo pieces like Omniscience and Roiling Dragonstorm to quickly overwhelm the opponent with powerful creatures and spells. It also includes cards like Fallaji Archaeologist and Marang River Regent to control the board and disrupt the opponent's strategy. The key to success lies in efficiently setting up the combo pieces while maintaining control of the game through counter spells and card draw. By combining synergy and strategic decision-making, the deck aims to create a devastating combo that can lead to a swift victory.

The main focus of this deck is to achieve an infinite combo using Omniscience to cast Roiling Dragonstorm repeatedly, creating a lock on the game by generating a large number of dragons. Marang River Regent and Fallaji Archaeologist help provide additional resources and support for the combo. The deck also includes cards like Ephara's Dispersal and Scrollshift to control the board and disrupt the opponent's strategy. Overall, the deck aims to quickly assemble its combo pieces and overwhelm the opponent with a powerful dragon army.

The deck focuses on fast and aggressive creature plays, backed by direct damage spells to quickly overwhelm the opponent. It utilizes a mix of low-cost creatures with strong abilities and burn spells to deal with both threats and players. The deck aims to maintain pressure on the opponent and finish the game quickly before the opponent can stabilize. It also includes some cards for card advantage, protection, and mana fixing to ensure consistency in draws and plays. With careful timing and sequencing, the deck can easily outpace and out damage most opposing strategies.

The main idea of this Red Deck Wins aggro deck is to overwhelm the opponent with fast, aggressive creatures and spells. By playing low-cost, efficient creatures like Emberheart Challenger and Hired Claw, and combining them with powerful spells like Burst Lightning and Monstrous Rage, this deck aims to deal quick and consistent damage to the opponent. Witchstalker Frenzy provides additional aggression, while cards like Magebane Lizard and Scorching Shot help to control the board and deal with threats. The deck's mana base is designed to support its aggressive game plan, with a focus on playing mountains for quick and easy access to red mana.

The main focus of this UR Aggro deck is to quickly deploy low-cost aggressive creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Drake Hatcher, and support them with efficient spells like Opt, Torch the Tower, and Monstrous Rage. By overwhelming the opponent early in the game and using card draw abilities like Stock Up and Sleight of Hand to maintain tempo, this deck aims to finish the game swiftly. With a land base that supports both colors evenly, this deck is designed for fast-paced and aggressive gameplay.
